intro: Doxosma × gracilis, commonly known as the slender doxosma, is a hybrid plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, branching structure and small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in opposite pairs. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
